title: unesco_heritage_Historic_Fortified_Town_of_Campeche
text:
Name: Historic Fortified Town of Campeche. short_description:

Campeche is a typical example of a harbour town from the Spanish colonial period in the New World. The historic centre has kept its outer walls and system of fortifications, designed to defend this Caribbean port against attacks from the sea.

. date_inscribed: 1999. danger: 0. date_end: . longitude: -90.53722. latitude: 19.84639. area_hectares: 181. category_long: Cultural. category_short: C. Country name: Mexico. Region: Latin America and the Caribbean. iso_code: mx. transboundary: 0. rev_bis: .
